meanings.definition: A lengthy and complicated procedure or process.
meanings.sent1: The rigmarole of filling out paperwork seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent2: After hours of rigmarole, they finally completed the project.
meanings.sent3: The rigmarole of untangling Christmas lights always makes me laugh.
meanings.sent4: Trying to navigate through the rigmarole of city traffic felt like a maze.
meanings.sent5: The rigmarole of assembling the furniture was a true test of patience.

meanings.sent1: She couldn't follow the rigmarole of gossip at the party.
meanings.sent2: The politician's speech was just a rigmarole of empty promises.
meanings.sent3: The children's game of telephone always ends up in rigmarole.
meanings.sent4: Listening to the conspiracy theorist's rigmarole was like entering a different world.
meanings.sent5: The rigmarole of the sales pitch left everyone feeling confused.
